classes.cCustomNote: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B1, B2, B3, (B4 [lab] must be completed with either B2 or B3), B1-B5 elective, C1, C2, C3, C4, D4, D5, and F. Courses in GE C4, D5, and F should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Two (2) courses must be completed from B1. No HIST class may be taken to satisfy GE D5. Refer to online catalog for GE course selection and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR).

Any free elective can go here. If Upper Division GE courses taken for letter grade are used to satisfy Major or Support requirements, additional units may be required to complete the 180 unit total degree requirement.

Upper Division GE courses taken for a letter grade satisfy Major or Support course requirements which would cause Free Electives to become 41 or more units, rather than 29 units. Some free electives may need to be 300-400 level to ensure completion of required minimum 60 units of upper division. Consult college advisor for more information.
CHIN, FR, GER, ITAL, JPNS, MLL, or SPAN 201, or equivalent course. Foreign Language 201 level, including any necessary prerequisites. Completed by fall of Sophomore year.

Any Upper Division Elective (HIST) can go here. Minimum of 12 units must be at the 400 level. HIST 400, 467, 468, 485, 495 cannot count towards the 24 units of History electives. Minimum of 12 units to be selected from Non-US, Non-European HIST courses (see catalog for list of options).

Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Any GWR class or GWR exam can go here. Refer to current catalog for prerequisites.
